issue.title: segfault when calling ipopt virtual method

content.raw:
As I was kind of blocked on this on Ubuntu 18.04, I tried to generate ABI-compatible Simbody 3.5 packages without the Ipopt symbols, 
the relevant branch is https://salsa.debian.org/traversaro-guest/simbody/tree/workaround/3.5_ipopt_fix . 

I am definitely not an expert at all of Debian packaging, but you can find the resulting deb packages at https://github.com/robotology/cer-sim/files/2544918/simbody-ubuntu-1804-ipopt-fix-dropin.zip .  It should be sufficient to just extract the archive and install the `libsimbody3.5v5_3.5.4+dfsg2-1_amd64.deb` package with 
~~~
dpkg -i libsimbody3.5v5_3.5.4+dfsg2-1_amd64.deb
~~~

**NOTE: THIS PACKAGES ARE UNSIGNED AND TOTALLY UNSUPPORTED, USE THEM ONLY IF YOU ARE FULLY AWARE OF WHAT YOU ARE DOING BY DOWNLOADING RANDOM UNSIGNED .deb PACKAGES FROM RANDOM ISSUES**
content.html:
As I was kind of blocked on this on Ubuntu 18.04, I tried to generate ABI-compatible Simbody 3.5 packages without the Ipopt symbols, the relevant branch is https://salsa.debian.org/traversaro-guest/simbody/tree/workaround/3.5_ipopt_fix .

I am definitely not an expert at all of Debian packaging, but you can find the resulting deb packages at https://github.com/robotology/cer-sim/files/2544918/simbody-ubuntu-1804-ipopt-fix-dropin.zip . It should be sufficient to just extract the archive and install the libsimbody3.5v5_3.5.4+dfsg2-1_amd64.deb package with 

dpkg -i libsimbody3.5v5_3.5.4+dfsg2-1_amd64.deb

NOTE: THIS PACKAGES ARE UNSIGNED AND TOTALLY UNSUPPORTED, USE THEM ONLY IF YOU ARE FULLY AWARE OF WHAT YOU ARE DOING BY DOWNLOADING RANDOM UNSIGNED .deb PACKAGES FROM RANDOM ISSUES
